name: Peanut Butter and Jellyfish Multiple Choice Quiz | Topics for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.correct: They can be almost any color
questions.explanation:
They can be almost any color.

	Jellyfish come in a huge variety of colors. Some are even multi-colored or change color as they grow. Their tentacles can also be more than one color. Jellyfish are the rainbows of the undersea world.

questions.text: Where do jellyfish get their name?
questions.correct: They have the texture of jelly
options: They are shaped like a jelly jar
questions.explanation:
They have the texture of jelly.

	Jellyfish are described as gelatinous. This means that they have a texture similar to jelly and/or gelatin. Their bodies are somewhat like a water filled balloon that feels like Jello and there are many sea creatures who love to eat them including sharks and other large fish.

questions.text: Which of the world's oceans has no jellyfish?
questions.correct: They can be found in every one of the world's oceans
questions.explanation:
They can be found in every one of the world's oceans.

	Jellyfish can be found in every ocean of the world. There are some types who live in freshwater also. Most live in shallow coastal waters, but there are a few types that have been found to inhabit depths of 12,000 feet.

questions.text: Which of the following things should you pour on a jellyfish sting?
questions.explanation:
Vinegar.

	The application of vinegar on a jellyfish sting deactivates the venom. Usually a trip to the doctor is in order when stung by a jellyfish. There are some varieties that are so venomous that they can kill a human. The sting of any jellyfish hurts badly.

questions.text: What does the diet of most jellyfish consist of?
questions.explanation:
Plankton and tiny fish.

	Jellyfish, depending on their size, eat plankton and small fish. They will eat almost anything that sticks to their tentacles, both plant and animal. When jellyfish are kept in an aquarium, small shrimp are often used as food.

questions.text: What do you call a large group of jellyfish?
questions.explanation:
Bloom.

	Jellyfish groups are called blooms. There can be over 100,000 animals in a bloom. Alternate terms for a bloom are smacks and swarms.

True.

	All jellyfish are between 90-95% water. They are semi-transparent, and move about by contracting and expanding their bodies. They are related to corals and sea anemones.

questions.text: Which of the following ferocious-sounding jellyfish is the largest?
questions.explanation:
Arctic lion's mane jellyfish.

	Jellyfish come in a large variety of sizes. The largest is the Arctic lion's mane jellyfish which can weigh as much as one ton and have tentacles as long as 100 feet. The smallest jellyfish is the Caribbean jellyfish which is one inch in size.

questions.text: Jellyfish have which one of the following body parts?
questions.explanation:
Mouth.

	Jellyfish do not have a brain, blood, nor any bones. They do have an elementary nervous system which is capable of detecting and responding to smell, light and other various forms of stimuli. The mouth is found on the bottom-side of their umbrella-shaped bodies and is used both to ingest food and expel food when they are done.

questions.text: Jellyfish are believed to be one of the oldest multi-organ animals in the world.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Jellyfish as a species are believed to be almost 700 million years old. They were around before people and dinosaurs. They are so plentiful that they often clog the motors of large ships and can cause a large mess if they wash ashore.
